    public interface Notifier
extends Cloneable
    A Notifier holds a set of listeners (see NotificationListener) that can be notified at different moments of the simulation.

    Use the addListener(int, NotificationListener) method to add listeners for specific notification codes, and the addGlobalListener(NotificationListener) to register a global listener (for all notification codes).

    Two methods can be used to notify the listeners: the notifyNow(int, Object) method and the notify(int, Object) method. These two methods take two parameters. The first is the notification code that is used to determine which listeners to notify (except for global listeners that are always notified). The second is an optional parameter that is supplied for the listeners.

    The notifyNow(int, Object) method, immediately notifies all the global listeners and all the listeners that have been added for the given notification code.

    The notify(int, Object) method, delays the notification of the matching listeners.
    Instead of immediately notifying the listeners, an event is scheduled at current simulation time. This behavior allows the caller to complete a given task before other tasks are executed. In another hand, we avoid to overburden the simulator's call stack.
    This method should be preferred over the notifyNow(int, Object) method. And if you need a given listener to be always immediately notified, then use InstantNotificationListener.

    Note that listeners can be discarded, and thus are never notified in the future.
    The NotificationListener.canBeNotified() is used to determine if listeners can be notified (ie: not discarded), and if they cannot then they are removed.

    The CoreNotificationCodes interface contains all predefined notification codes.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGlobalListener(NotificationListener listener)
      Adds the given listener as a global listener that will be triggered for any notification code.
      Nothing is done if the listener was already added.
      void addListener(int notification_code, NotificationListener listener)
      Adds the given listener for the given notification_code.
      Nothing is done if the listener was already added for the same notification_code.
      void cancelNotifications()
      Cancels all previously scheduled events using notify(int, Object).
      void cleanupListeners()
      This method iterates through all listeners (including global listeners), and checks for discarded listeners and removes them.
      Notifier clone()
      Creates a clone of this Notifier.
      void disableNotifications()
      Further notifications are disabled.
      void enableNotifications()
      Further notifications are enabled.
      Collection<NotificationListener> getGlobalListeners()
      Returns a collection containing all global listeners.
      Collection<NotificationListener> getListeners(int notification_code)
      Returns a collection containing all listeners for the given notification_code.
      boolean isNotificationsDisabled()
      Returns true if notifications are disabled.
      void notify(int notification_code, Object data)
      For each listener that was added using the given notification_code, this method does one of the following actions.
      void notifyNow(int notification_code, Object data)
      Executes the code of all listeners that were added for the given notification_code.
      Collection<NotificationListener> removeAllGlobalListeners()
      Removes all the global listeners and returns a collection containing the removed listeners.
      Collection<NotificationListener> removeAllListeners()
      Removes all added listeners, including global listeners, and returns a collection containing the removed listeners.
      Collection<NotificationListener> removeAllListeners(int notification_code)
      Removes all the listeners for the given notification_code and returns a collection containing the removed listeners.
      boolean removeGlobalListener(NotificationListener listener)
      Removes the given listener from the list of global listeners.
      boolean removeListener(int notification_code, NotificationListener listener)
      Removes the given listener for the given notification_code and returns true on success.

      • clone

        Notifier clone()
        Creates a clone of this Notifier.

        The clone will contain a new empty listeners list and is independent from this object.

      • removeAllListeners

        Collection<NotificationListener> removeAllListeners()
        Removes all added listeners, including global listeners, and returns a collection containing the removed listeners.
        Returns:
        a collection containing removed listeners

      • cleanupListeners

        void cleanupListeners()
        This method iterates through all listeners (including global listeners), and checks for discarded listeners and removes them.

        You are not required to call this method after discarding a NotificationListener, because, anyhow, this entity will not use them in the future.
        Call this method only if you need this entity to immediately remove discarded listeners.

        After calling this method, this entity is guaranteed to not reference any discarded listener.

      • notifyNow

        void notifyNow(int notification_code,
             Object data)
        Executes the code of all listeners that were added for the given notification_code. The data parameter is supplied for the listener.

        The calling order of the listeners is undetermined. Thus a new listener may be called before an older listener and vice versa.

        Listeners of which NotificationListener.canBeNotified() method returns false are ignored and removed from the list of listeners.

        Parameters:
        notification_code -
        data - extra data supplied for the listener when its code is executed

      • notify

        void notify(int notification_code,
          Object data)
        For each listener that was added using the given notification_code, this method does one of the following actions.

        If calling NotificationListener.isInstantNotification() returns true then the listener's code is executed immediately.

        If calling NotificationListener.isInstantNotification() returns false then this method schedules an event in order to execute the listener's code.

        Regarding the last case, there should be an individual event for each listener, and each of them is scheduled at the current simulator's time.
        Also, this method will not schedule another event for a listener if it already has another scheduled and not yet processed event with the same notification_code and data.

        The calling order of the listeners is undetermined. Thus a new listener may be called before an older listener and vice versa.

        Use notifyNow(int, Object) to notify listeners immediately.

        Parameters:
        notification_code -
        data - extra data supplied for the listener when its code is executed

      • cancelNotifications

        void cancelNotifications()
        Cancels all previously scheduled events using notify(int, Object).

      • isNotificationsDisabled

        boolean isNotificationsDisabled()
        Returns true if notifications are disabled.
        Returns:
        true if notifications are disabled

      • disableNotifications

        void disableNotifications()
        Further notifications are disabled. Which means that all further calls to notifyNow(int, Object) or notify(int, Object) are ignored.

        Note: If there were scheduled notifications using notify(int, Object), then those are not canceled after calling this method. If you want to cancel them use cancelNotifications().

      • enableNotifications

        void enableNotifications()
        Further notifications are enabled. Which means that all further calls to notifyNow or notify are not ignored.
